job_title: Patient Service Representative in Huntington, WV
pros: Great pay and good staff
cons: I have no cons to list

review_title: Great place to build nursing skills.
pros: Lots of co-workers who are highly experienced. Generous amount of vacation, sick time, and holiday pay. Immediate supervisor is an excellent manager.
cons: Extremely outdated and shoddy equipment, particularly technology related. Antiquated EMR systems and different areas of the hospital use different ones. When you get a patient from the ICU or the ER, you can’t see everything that would be pertinent as the nurse. Leadership seems to only be worried about money. Forced the care delivery model to change which reduces the number of licensed staff on the floor but tries to convince everyone that it’s a good thing. CNO has never been a bedside nurse and it’s apparent every time he makes a decision. Six month waiting period before any sick or vacation time can be used, even though it’s being accrued. They make you wait an entire year before you can enroll in dental coverage. The cafeteria is extremely expensive and the discount is pathetic.

pros: Dynamic work. Fast paced. Evenings free.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Apple Valley, CA
pros: If you were looking for a job in the Healthcare industry in Victorville, It would be good opportunity for you. They have hired me three different times, because they needed someone with the skill I have,
cons: They are a facility with old equipment so it is difficult to work. Most of the Managers do not have the education it takes to work with people. The rules there are strict and I am too old for that. They change your hours according to departmental needs. The unions suck. I worked Tue. 3-ll pm and came back to work at 6 am. Always tired. Some of management are very immature and dont know the meaning of supervision. My job was HIM Coder and I took a AS to get that job, but my direct supervisor had only high school. The department director had the same course I took at Santa Barbara City College, we had the same credentials RHIT. She at least had that and I did not want promotion, I just feel that a person in that position should have more, but she did her job well at times. The former director was a joke. She was vulgar and just the opposite of what a director should be.

job_title: Junior Full Stack Developer in Huntington, WV
pros: My immediate management and coworkers were great. My supervisor cared about me and consistently praised my work.
cons: The upper management is going through a weird transition as St. Mary's merges with Cabell Huntington. As we were told "We're not sure when we'll be able to up your pay to match with Cabell," the merger also talked about extensive expansion and bought a nearby entertainment arena. It's a lot of mixed messaging, and I don't have hope for the merger.

review_title: Good reputation not great working culture
job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) in Huntington, WV
pros: Great co workers benefits are nice
cons: Float too often paid straight pay even though floated shift diff is not real good

pros: Pay.....But it is not worth it.
cons:
I was a new RN and my preceptor had been an RN for 6 months. I asked for someone else to train me. My manager flat out said no. When I was left to fend for myself w 7 patients to care for, I hadn’t been taught many things. The manager asked why I didn’t know how to do certain things then they put me with another RN for a day. I informed my manager that I had asked for a new preceptor but was turned down.
It is a dramatic atmosphere with the nurses. Favoritism is huge. Bullying is a huge issue. Especially from my charge nurse and CNAs that blatantly ignored you when asking for their help with baths. One charge nurse would yell but act sweet as could be around the manager. It is not a team atmosphere. It is very political and if you’re an introvert, expect to get patients who are total care. Nurses who whine are rewarded and their assignments were changed. Their system rewards complainers, the people that constantly run to managers, but not people who keep their head down and simply want to go there to work. My manager even told me one patient’s family liked me so much and that’s why I was always assigned to them...it was the most difficult patient on the floor. It’s a shame because I started liking the actual job. However, I had trouble sleeping and couldn’t stand the atmosphere surrounding the job. Perhaps if everyone were treated equally and drama/favoritism/bullying wasn’t permitted, I would have stayed. There were some good RNs there but the negative ones ran the unit during most of the week.

pros: Great co workers like family

job_title: Registered Nurse in Apple Valley, CA
pros: The work was a wonderful experience and there was a lot of teamwork. There was a good mesh of new grads and experienced nurses. The charge nurses were for the most part very helpful.
cons: The patients on the floor I was on were very acute patients and it was extremely stressful to work there. I experienced many "codes" my first year working there but in all honesty I would not have changed the experience even though my stomach hurt every minute I was there because of stress.

pros: People are caring, helpful, competent and professionally excellent. The culture is all about teamwork and doing more than what was required, going the extra mile for patients and co-workers. Management is supportive.
